column4: hey.. need some advice on a laptop purchase: are there any limitations as to CPUs not supported by kernel?
in an advert it clearly states that windows xp is not supported
CPU is a 2.40 GHz Intel C2 DUO T8300 800MHz 3MB
sorry - any x86 or x86_64 is supported
so linux kernel does not give a rats *ss about registers and internal structure of a CPU as long as its x86 or 64. why cant xp run with it?
ok, so don't ask about it then
so ask microsoft if XP is supported
so ask that company - not ubuntu
i know thats where i'll get the real answer, but I thought I would try asking here
why ? it's nothing to do with ubuntu
well... i had two questions... kernel in ubuntu support... and supplementary question: xp
may serve you well to check the topic
i know i know.... i wont bother you with questions not 100% concerning ubuntu again then
thanks for helping about though even though the question was "off-topic"
